title: MGMT Discography - Albums, Live, Remixes + More
description:
This is MY version of the MGMT discgography, as of 27.10.2008


As a fan over the last few months, I have collected their work from various places, and have come together with the most concise and detailed collection of their work possible.

MGMT were previously known as "The Management"

--------------------------------------------------------------
Officially, the "Discography" as they claim is as follows:
 <a href="
http://www.virtual-studios.net/mystuff/mgmt/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.virtual-studios.net/mystuff/mgmt/</a>

However I have alot more in this torrent that any fan will enjoy.
--------------------------------------------------------------

This torrent includes:

BBC Radio1 2/07/08 Zane Lowe Show
BBC Session 2008_07_02
Brandon Creath&#039;s Album
Climbing To New Lows
Early Bootleg Recordings
Electric Feel [CD Single]
Electric Feel [Single - 12" Vinyl]
Electric Feel [Single - 7" Vinyl]

Hyperbole

Kids [CD Single]

Time To Pretend [CD Single PROMO]
Time To Pretend [CD Single]
Time To Pretend [Single - 7"]
Time To Pretend EP
Time To Pretend PROMO
Tripple J Podcast 06/05/2008
We (don&#039;t) Care EP
21 (Music From The Motion Picture)
4/07/08 BBC Radio 1 Zane Lowe Show - Recorded Earlier


This is a detailed discography including all albums, demo&#039;s, indie albums, live, singles, vinyl rips, remixes, mashups, radio shows, interviews and even podcasts.


All files that are not .mp3 are fully capable of being played on all mainstream and most ordinary plyers: itunes, Winamp, Windows Media Player etc.


Long file names get cut off in torrents - so to save you the research bother, all long track names that may be lost can be found in the "comments" on the ID3 tag of the .mp3 file.



For more info check their wikipedia page:
 <a href="
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MGMT" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MGMT</a>



There is no official forum board for band discussion as of yet, however I have found that: 
 <a href="
http://www.e6townhall.com/showthread.php?t=10417" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.e6townhall.com/showthread.php?t=10417</a>   

is the next best place, with the thread being dedicated to discussion of releases and other info.
